External Websites Category: [Science & Tech](/Science-Tech) - acupressure, or shiatsu, [alternative-medicine](https://www.britannica.com/science/medicine/Alternative-or-complementary-medicine#ref35490) practice in which pressure is applied to points on the body aligned along 12 main [meridians](https://www.britannica.com/dictionary/meridians) (pathways), usually for a short time, to improve the flow of [qi](https://www.britannica.com/topic/qi-Chinese-philosophy) (life force). Though often referred to by its Japanese name, shiatsu, it originated in China thousands of years ago. A single point may be pressed to relieve a specific symptom or condition, or a series of points can be worked on to promote overall well-being. Some studies suggest that acupressure can be effective for certain health problems, including [nausea](https://www.britannica.com/topic/Nausea-novel-by-Sartre), [pain](https://www.britannica.com/science/pain), and [stroke](https://www.britannica.com/science/stroke-disease)-related weakness.
